item.title: 无与伦比的美股让分散投资者望尘莫及
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在选举中获胜后，"美国优先"（America First）的交易在本周再次兴起，银行和小型公司昨日推动股市不断走高。尽管最近出现了一些与货币相关的不安情绪，但投资者仍在继续押注特朗普的政策议程--包括放松监管和促进国内企业战胜外国竞争对手的举措--将为美国股市长期以来优于全球市场的表现再添一把火。【原文：The “America First” trade that surged in the immediate aftermath of Donald Trump’s electoral victory is on display again this week, with banks and smaller companies pushing the stock market ever higher yesterday. Despite some recent monetary-related jitters, investors are continuing to bet that Trump’s policy agenda -- including de-regulation and moves to boost domestic business over foreign competitors -- will add fresh fuel to the long-standing outperformance of US equities over world markets.】

item.title: 反对党支持的候选人在雅加达省长竞选中领先
item.description: 据最新调查显示，在距离雅加达地区选举不到一周的时间里，印尼反对党支持的一名候选人在关键的雅加达省长竞选中处于领先地位。【原文：A candidate backed by Indonesia’s opposition has taken the lead in the pivotal race for Jakarta governor less than a week before the regional elections, according to the latest survey.】

item.description: 另类资产管理公司战神管理公司（Ares Management Corp.【原文：Alternative asset manager Ares Management Corp. is considering setting up shop in Milan to target lending opportunities to businesses that currently lack access to private credit.】

item.title: 匈牙利认为制裁俄罗斯天然气工业银行是对能源安全的威胁
item.description: 匈牙利说，美国制裁俄罗斯天然气工业银行的决定危及一些中欧国家的能源安全，增加了俄罗斯提前切断向欧洲大陆输送天然气的风险。【原文：Hungary said the US decision to sanction Gazprombank jeopardizes the energy security of some central European countries, elevating the risks of an early cutoff of Russian gas to the continent.】

item.title: 美国调查摩根大通与伊朗石油大亨对冲基金的关系
item.description: 美国财政部正在审查摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The US Treasury Department is examining JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s relationship with a hedge fund that’s said to be part of a network overseen by Iranian oil trader Hossein Shamkhani.】

item.title: 德意志银行称监管机构首次对放宽规则持开放态度
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）首席执行官克里斯蒂安-斯温（Christian Sewing）说，他看到欧洲官员们前所未有地愿意减轻该地区经济的监管负担。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG Chief Executive Officer Christian Sewing said he sees an unprecedented readiness among European officials to alleviate the regulatory burden on the region’s economy.】

item.title: 野村、大和详述其共同基金中的阿达尼风险敞口
item.description: 在美国检察官对印度阿达尼集团的亿万富翁创始人提出指控后，野村控股公司和大和证券集团的资产管理部门公布了其共同基金持有阿达尼集团公司证券的详细情况。【原文：The asset management arms of Nomura Holdings Inc. and Daiwa Securities Group released details of their mutual funds’ holdings of securities in the Adani Group companies, after US prosecutors filed charges against the Indian conglomerate’s billionaire founder.】

item.title: 土耳其减少里拉流动性以支持货币政策目标
item.description: 土耳其中央银行提高了部分里拉存款的准备金要求，以清理金融体系中过剩的流动性，加强货币政策对市场利率的影响。【原文：Turkey’s central bank raised reserve requirements for some lira deposits to mop up excess liquidity from the financial system and strengthen monetary policy’s impact on market interest rates.】

item.title: 肯尼亚因对国际货币基金组织（IMF）资金的担忧而错开 15 亿美元的阿联酋贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，肯尼亚计划分批提取与阿布扎比达成的 15 亿美元贷款，以保持在国际货币基金组织计划规定的借款限额之内。【原文：Kenya plans to draw down on a $1.5 billion loan agreed with Abu Dhabi in tranches to remain within borrowing thresholds set in an International Monetary Fund program, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 香港基准指数将增加瓜分，剔除新世界
item.description: 香港恒生指数编制公司发表声明称，在进行季度审查后，将把瓜子二手车和新东方教育科技集团股份有限公司纳入香港恒生指数，并把新世界发展有限公司剔除。【原文：Kuaishou Technology and New Oriental Education & Technology Group Inc. will be added to Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index and New World Development Co. removed following a quarterly review, according to a statement from the index compiler.】

item.title: 谨慎的南非央行将在 2025 年少量降息
item.description: 南非储备银行行长莱塞特贾-克加亚戈（Lesetja Kganyago）一再强调不确定性，预计明年最多也只会再降息几次。【原文：South African Reserve Bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago’s repeated emphasis of uncertainty is expected to translate, at most, into only a handful of additional interest-rate cuts next year.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"似乎将就在线产量问题召开下一次重要会议
item.description: 欧佩克+"的代表们说，他们认为下个月关于恢复石油生产计划的会议将在网上举行，而不是按原计划在维也纳总部举行。【原文：OPEC+ delegates said they assume next month’s meeting on plans to restore oil production will be held online, rather than at their Vienna headquarters as originally planned.】

item.title: 避险需求推动美元创一年来最长涨势
item.description: 由于地缘政治紧张局势升级刺激了对避险货币的需求，美元将创下一年多来最长的周涨幅。【原文：The dollar is set for its longest run of weekly gains in more than a year, as escalating geopolitical tensions boost demand for the haven currency.】

item.title: 美银美林称有利于美股的贸易看似有解除的风险
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，纳斯达克 100 指数相对于标准普尔 500 指数正在接近一个水平，可能会引发有利于美国股市的交易平仓。【原文：The Nasdaq 100 is approaching a level versus the S&P 500 that could trigger the unwinding of the trade favoring US equities, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 欧洲央行金多斯称降息幅度不如路径重要
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，欧洲央行显然正走在降息的道路上，但每次货币政策会议的降息幅度并不那么重要。【原文：The European Central Bank is clearly on a path of lowering interest rates, but how much it cuts at each monetary policy meeting is not as important, Vice President Luis de Guindos said.】

item.title: 英国采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，预算案增税后英国私营部门停滞不前
item.description: 一项备受关注的调查显示，企业对英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）的财政计划 "明确地竖起了大拇指"。【原文：The UK private sector slipped from solid growth to stagnation after the budget as a closely-watched survey showed firms gave a “clear thumbs down” to UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves’ fiscal plans.】

item.title: 西班牙政府向顶级银行征收更高的暴利税
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）在向西班牙最大的银行增收暴利税后，正与这些银行陷入严重对峙。【原文：Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is heading into a major stand-off with the Spain’s biggest banks after slapping them with an increase in windfall tax.】

item.title: 印度股市将迎来五个月来最好的一天，阿达尼股价震荡上行
item.description: 受贷款机构和市场重量级企业信实工业公司（Reliance Industries）的提振，印度基准股票指数创下自 6 月初以来的最大涨幅。【原文：India’s benchmark equity gauge headed for its biggest gain since early June, boosted by lenders and market heavyweight Reliance Industries.】

item.title: 欧元区私营部门意外陷入萎缩
item.description: 欧元区 11 月份的商业活动意外萎缩，这表明政治混乱和贸易不和加剧正在造成破坏。【原文：Euro-area business activity unexpectedly shrank in November, a sign of the damage being wrought by political chaos and heightened discord over trade.】

item.title: Northvolt 首席执行官 Peter Carlsson 在申请破产后第二天辞职
item.description: 瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt AB 表示，其首席执行官彼得-卡尔松（Peter Carlsson）将在破产法庭的保护下开始重组，并将卸任。【原文：Northvolt AB said its chief executive officer, Peter Carlsson, is stepping down as the Swedish battery maker embarks on a restructuring under bankruptcy court protection.】

item.title: 欧洲央行降息押注激增，欧元跌至 2022 年以来最低点
item.description: 欧元跌至两年来的最低水平，因为交易商押注欧洲央行将不得不大幅降息以刺激该地区的经济。【原文：The euro fell to the lowest level in two years as traders bet the European Central Bank will have to cut interest rates aggressively to bolster the region’s economy.】

item.title: 中国誓言帮助企业扩大出口，尽管反弹日益强烈
item.description: 尽管全球对中国廉价商品的涌入反弹不断升温，中国政府仍承诺支持本国企业增加出口，中国将努力进一步促进出口。【原文：China will attempt to boost exports further, with Beijing promising to support its firms to increase shipments despite a rising global backlash over an influx of cheap Chinese goods.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德就欧盟在资本市场联盟问题上的惰性敲响警钟
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲在创新方面的持续努力和地缘政治背景的恶化使得联合其资本市场变得更加迫切。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said Europe’s continuing struggle to innovate and the souring geopolitical backdrop make it even more imperative to unite its capital markets.】

item.title: 德国私营部门因服务业而进一步陷入萎缩
item.description: 德国私营部门活动的萎缩在 11 月份进一步加剧，这给目前正面临政府垮台、经济增长乏力的德国经济带来了又一次打击。【原文：The contraction in Germany‘s private-sector activity worsened in November, dealing another blow to an economy that’s now grappling with a government collapse alongside flat-lining growth.】

item.title: 中国重启日本人入境免签政策以巩固两国关系
item.description: 中国将重启对日本国民的免签证入境政策，以促进两国的商务和旅游关系。【原文：China will restart visa-free entry for Japanese nationals to facilitate business and tourism as both countries seek to shore up ties.】
